links.text: What?

links.title: Shivers: "Far away and outside... the reeds h..."
links.text: Far away and outside... the reeds hiss with desperation. Step out.

links.title: You: "I'll take this outside. [Leave.]"
links.text: I'll take this outside. [Leave.]

links.title: You: "Keep reading."
links.text: Keep reading.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "Your hand shakes, holding the card...."
links.text: Your hand shakes, holding the card. "Every morning when I step out and you're asleep behind me," it says. "I find a little piece of sadness in me. I carry it in my chest down Voyager Road..."

links.title: Damaged Ledger: ""Every step I take, it grows. By th..."
links.text: "Every step I take, it grows. By the time I reach the fuel station it has filled me entirely. I step on the light rail and look back, sparks fall from the bow collector. I know it will be like this until late afternoon, when I get off the 42 -- and walk back to you..."

links.title: You: "Keep reading."
links.text: Keep reading.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: ""You, you... Every step I take will..."
links.text: "You, you... Every step I take will get lighter. It almost makes me run! Sometimes I do. I can't believe I met you. I can't believe the happiness I feel with you. You have a vast, vast soul and I will always, always, always come back to it."

links.title: You: "Keep reading."
links.text: Keep reading.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: ""Kisses, kisses, kisses." You feel..."
links.text: "Kisses, kisses, kisses." You feel the air sucked out of your lungs and the blood sucked out of your head. Everything around you gets dark. Small white dots appear...

links.title: Conceptualization: "Sparks fall like snow from the bow..."
links.text: Sparks fall like snow from the bow collector. A street-car distancing...

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "You feel the ledger slip from your..."
links.text: You feel the ledger slip from your hand.

links.title: Endurance: "No! No! Hold on."
links.text: No! No! Hold on.

links.title: You: "Hold on."
links.text: Hold on.

links.title: Endurance: "To what? There's nothing..."
links.text: To what? There's nothing...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, is everything alright?""
links.text: "Detective, is everything alright?"

links.title: You: "Fall sideways."
links.text: Fall sideways.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: ""Kisses, kisses, kisses." You feel..."
links.text: "Kisses, kisses, kisses." You feel the air sucked out of your lungs and the blood sucked out of your head. Everything around you gets dark. Small white dots appear...

links.title: You: "Stop, put it back..."
links.text: Stop, put it back...

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "You jam the compartment shut, it's..."
links.text: You jam the compartment shut, it's hard to breathe. The air in your lungs feels sour somehow. The drawer is locked, blue ink drips from the white pages in your hand.

links.title: You: "Put it away!"
links.text: Put it away!

links.title: You: "Put it back."
links.text: Put it back.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "Your fingers are sweaty. There is a..."
links.text: Your fingers are sweaty. There is a sweat mark where they held the wax paper. The card lies next to the ticket stubs.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "You feel that thing in the back of..."
links.text: You feel that thing in the back of your head? That little voice, that quiet scream? You already felt this was a bad idea, but especially right now it's even worse. Try as you might, you can't read it now.

links.title: Volition: "You've got *business* to deal with..."
links.text: You've got *business* to deal with first. Talk to the Union boss first, at least... I can't stop you for long, but there's just enough of an excuse now.

links.title: You: "Fucking kill yourself you asshole."
links.text: Fucking kill yourself you asshole.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "The words just... *crossed* your mi..."
links.text: The words just... *crossed* your mind somehow.

links.title: You: "Who were they for?"
links.text: Who were they for?

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "Who do you think?"
links.text: Who do you think?

links.title: Pain Threshold: "You."
links.text: You.

links.title: You: "Blink."
links.text: Blink.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "You see two ticket stubs and a hand..."
links.text: You see two ticket stubs and a handmade card.

links.title: You: "Close the permeables' compartment."
links.text: Close the permeables' compartment.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "It's slightly -- ever so slightly -..."
links.text: It's slightly -- ever so slightly -- difficult to breathe once you've done so. The drawer is locked, blue ink drips from the white pages in your hand.

links.title: Half Light: "Your hand shakes. You're flushed wi..."
links.text: Your hand shakes. You're flushed with adrenaline.

links.title: You: "What's inside?"
links.text: What's inside?

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "Two ticket stubs and a handmade pos..."
links.text: Two ticket stubs and a handmade postcard.

links.title: You: "Open the hidden compartment in the..."
links.text: Open the hidden compartment in the clipboard.

links.title: Interfacing: "Hmm. The two sides of the board app..."
links.text: Hmm. The two sides of the board appear slightly misaligned. Like a drawer that's come off the slides. If you *bend* the plastic on your knee, slowly...

links.title: Interfacing: "...the slides *snap* back into plac..."
links.text: ...the slides *snap* back into place. It should be possible to just... you know...

links.title: You: "Slide the drawer open."
links.text: Slide the drawer open.

links.title: You: "Wait... somehow I don't want to."
links.text: Wait... somehow I don't want to.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "What are you waiting for? Just..."
links.text: What are you waiting for? Just...

links.title: Inland Empire: "That's because you know where this..."
links.text: That's because you know where this leads to.

links.title: Horrific Necktie: "That doesn't sound like it's gonna..."
links.text: That doesn't sound like it's gonna be *fun*.

links.title: You: "Fuck no -- put the ledger away. [Le..."
links.text: Fuck no -- put the ledger away. [Leave.]

links.title: Interfacing: "...is *STILL* NOT WHAT HAPPENS. Fuc..."
links.text: ...is *STILL* NOT WHAT HAPPENS. Fuck this compartment. You should throw it away.

links.title: Empathy: "Strange? Why does it make you so an..."
links.text: Strange? Why does it make you so angry?

links.title: Interfacing: "...is *not* what you end up doing...."
links.text: ...is *not* what you end up doing. You squeeze the plastic to slide it open, but nothing happens. Then you bend it some. Then crack it. The god damn thing is stuck.

links.title: Half Light: "A hot flash of rage comes over you...."
links.text: A hot flash of rage comes over you. For a moment there -- before it recedes -- you feel as though you might just squeeze a tear of anger out of your duct. Makes you wonder... why?

links.title: Empathy: "It's unjust, that's why. You can't..."
links.text: It's unjust, that's why. You can't even *get* to that thing anymore!

links.title: Electrochemistry: "The fucking drunks, it's their faul..."
links.text: The fucking drunks, it's their fault. You should've drunk the liquor out of that fucker's SKULL...

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "The ledger quivers in your hand. As..."
links.text: The ledger quivers in your hand. As it shakes the pages rustle. This pathetic mess suddenly afraid of you for some reason.

links.title: You: "Smell the ledger."
links.text: Smell the ledger.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "The acidic stench of rotting food h..."
links.text: The acidic stench of rotting food has rubbed off on the cellulose. It now forms the *base* of the experience. This base surrounded by a faint air of spoiled meat -- the stuff of death itself! -- and then sprinkled liberally with the citrus zest of toilet cleaner.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "You know -- like the bits they put..."
links.text: You know -- like the bits they put into public piss bowls; probably called *Fermi-Discrete* or *Axel* or something. At some point in its journey the ledger has seen the inside of a public toilet.

links.title: You: "I know, I know. Sylvie already told..."
links.text: I know, I know. Sylvie already told me I dunked it in the toilet.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "If you knew it was dunked in the to..."
links.text: If you knew it was dunked in the toilet before getting chucked into the trash, why're you sniffing it?

links.title: You: "The option to sniff was there, so....."
links.text: The option to sniff was there, so...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "... so you wanted to get in on the..."
links.text: ... so you wanted to get in on the trash-toilet stink collab? Find out what happens when those two get *funky* together? Okay, pal.

links.title: You: "This is getting weird and hostile...."
links.text: This is getting weird and hostile. Sorry, nose -- let's just move on.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Your nose is somewhere between grat..."
links.text: Your nose is somewhere between grateful and resentful.

links.title: You: "Are you angry with me, nose?"
links.text: Are you angry with me, nose?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Yeah, turns out your nose doesn't l..."
links.text: Yeah, turns out your nose doesn't like self-indulgent literal-shit huffing. *Quelle fuckin' surprise*. Come on, no more -- the ledger is going back down, away from your nose now.

links.title: You: "I'm a police man. This is police wo..."
links.text: I'm a police man. This is police work. I'm just following the leads, you know?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Torturing your own nose -- for no r..."
links.text: Torturing your own nose -- for no reason! -- is not *conducive* to case-cracking, bud.

links.title: You: "Maybe, uh -- maybe it's my fetish?..."
links.text: Maybe, uh -- maybe it's my fetish? Maybe? Ever think of that, nose?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Garbage-toilet stink is not your fe..."
links.text: Garbage-toilet stink is not your fetish and you know it. Your nose does *not* fucking like this.

links.title: You: "Shut up, nose. I don't need your he..."
links.text: Shut up, nose. I don't need your help -- I don't need *anyone's* help!

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Your nose does not understand what..."
links.text: Your nose does not understand what it did wrong.

links.title: You: "Which toilet would that be?"
links.text: Which toilet would that be?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Remember when I said the smell of t..."
links.text: Remember when I said the smell of the upstairs bathroom was so rank they should have sent a *poet* to describe it?

links.title: You: "Is "sprinkled liberally with the ci..."
links.text: Is "sprinkled liberally with the citrus zest of toilet cleaner" a line this poet might have used?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Why yes it is! Among many other thi..."
links.text: Why yes it is! Among many other things. This cleaning tablet is used by the Whirling-in-Rags -- perhaps that's where the ledger was dropped in the toilet? By you.

links.title: You: "Not really."
links.text: Not really.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Maybe you should pay more attention..."
links.text: Maybe you should pay more attention then? Anyway, what your nose is trying tell you is -- the ledger was dropped into a toilet in the Whirling-in-Rags, by you. The toilet cleaner in your room smells exactly the same.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "*Which*? You're not sure you've sme..."
links.text: *Which*? You're not sure you've smelled this one yet, or worse... you have the nagging feeling you might have missed it.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant observes you raising..."
links.text: The lieutenant observes you raising and lowering the toilet-water-logged mass under your nose, trying to get a good whiff. A good *analytical* whiff.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "After a while he can't take it anym..."
links.text: After a while he can't take it anymore. "Excuse me, I just have to ask again -- *how* did it get in the trash?"

links.title: You: ""I'm pretty sure I -- or someone el..."
links.text: "I'm pretty sure I -- or someone else -- dropped it into the toilet in my hostel room bathroom. The tablet's the same." (Tap on your nose.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, good." There is a moment's s..."
links.text: "Okay, good." There is a moment's silence. "But *why*?"

links.title: You: ""I think I didn't want to be a cop..."
links.text: "I think I didn't want to be a cop anymore."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sad to hear that." For a momen..."
links.text: "I'm sad to hear that." For a moment he doesn't know what to reply.

links.title: Empathy: "He's sorry for you."
links.text: He's sorry for you.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In any case, we're lucky you found..."
links.text: "In any case, we're lucky you found it. Make sure it's all in there. Official notes are... well they're dangerous, they contain confidentialities."

links.title: You: ""It must have been cramping my styl..."
links.text: "It must have been cramping my style."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer, however damaged -- that....."
links.text: "Officer, however damaged -- that..." he points to it, "...is still an official piece of paperwork. It probably contains notes on *numerous* ongoing investigations. It could even list undercover operatives. Certainly informants. I suggest integrating it into your *style*. For all our sakes."

links.title: Composure: "Easier said than done -- how could..."
links.text: Easier said than done -- how could this pathetic mess of copy paper and plastic ever become *tr√®s disco*?"

links.title: Conceptualization: "Challenge accepted. You should be o..."
links.text: Challenge accepted. You should be on the lookout for stylistic elements that elevate this cabbage to heights unforeseeable.

links.title: You: "I don't know, it seems foreboding t..."
links.text: I don't know, it seems foreboding to me somehow. Like there's something in there that's out to get me.

links.title: Conceptualization: "What are you talking about? No one'..."
links.text: What are you talking about? No one's out to get you -- get real man! Upgrade that cop-ledger!

links.title: You: "Alright then. Seems like a good ide..."
links.text: Alright then. Seems like a good idea.  (Accept.)

links.title: Conceptualization: "It is -- look at how basic that thi..."
links.text: It is -- look at how basic that thing is! Basic clip, unglamorous toilet-smelling papers. It could do with some *pizzazzo*" Cheer you right up.

links.title: You: "What I should do is get back to mak..."
links.text: What I should do is get back to making sense of this thing. (Discard.)

links.title: Conceptualization: "I don't know... have you seen how *..."
links.text: I don't know... have you seen how *basic* that thing is? Basic clip, unglamorous toilet-smelling papers. It could've done with some *pizzazzo*! Anyway, go on. Sorry I said anything.

links.title: You: ""It has a.. foreboding quality to i..."
links.text: "It has a.. foreboding quality to it. I'm picking up dark vibes. Maybe I *had* to lose it?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You had to lose because of *dark v..."
links.text: "You had to lose because of *dark vibes*? What are you talking about?"

links.title: You: ""I don't know.""
links.text: "I don't know."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't know either..." He points..."
links.text: "I don't know either..." He points to the ruined notes. "You should take stock of those, make sure it's all there. Official notes contain informants' names, undercover operatives even. If some of it has fallen into the hands of the RCM's adversaries, bloodletting may well ensue."

links.title: You: ""I speaketh the tongue.""
links.text: "I speaketh the tongue."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do-eth thou also thorough inventor..."
links.text: "Do-eth thou also thorough inventories?" He points to the ruined notes. "You should take stock of those. Official notes contain informants' names, undercover operatives even. If some of it has fallen into the hands of the RCM's adversaries, bloodletting may well ensue."

links.title: You: ""It has a.. foreboding quality to i..."
links.text: "It has a.. foreboding quality to it. Maybe I *needed* to lose it, for the great bloodletting to begin..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You had to lose it for *the bloodl..."
links.text: "You had to lose it for *the bloodletting* to begin? What are you talking about?"

links.title: You: ""Someone from the Whirling threw it..."
links.text: "Someone from the Whirling threw it in the trash? I don't know. I'm boring."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Boring? Try *dangerous*. You shoul..."
links.text: "Boring? Try *dangerous*. You should do a thorough inventory of that -- make sure some has not fallen into the hands of the RCM's enemies: organized crime, or worse... Official notes sometimes contain informants' names, even undercover operatives."

links.title: Half Light: "Oh god, that sounds dangerous. Make..."
links.text: Oh god, that sounds dangerous. Make sure you don't throw it out again.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, if you'll excuse me..." He re..."
links.text: "Now, if you'll excuse me..." He reopens his own *pristine* blue notebook. "That thing has filled me with the sudden urge to make sure mine is in *perfect* order."

links.title: Interfacing: "Needless. It looks great. Unlike yo..."
links.text: Needless. It looks great. Unlike yours, which is an unholy mass dripping with excrement.

links.title: You: ""Yeah, I still don't want to discus..."
links.text: "Yeah, I still don't want to discuss it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, no problem." He turns away t..."
links.text: "Okay, no problem." He turns away to start organizing his own notes -- leaving you with yours.

links.title: Empathy: "He's not mad -- that smelly mess of..."
links.text: He's not mad -- that smelly mess of paper in your hand is making him worry about the well being of his own paperwork, that's all.

links.title: You: "[Put the ledger away.]"
links.text: [Put the ledger away.]

dialogueTree.title: Damaged Ledger: "It's the ledger you found in the tr..."
dialogueTree.text: It's the ledger you found in the trash: a pitiful cabbage of white and yellow papers hanging from plastic board, barely held together by a metal clip. This sad display is made complete by the faint smell of urinal cleaner.

links.title: You: "Anything *else*?"
links.text: Anything *else*?

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "There's a piece of toilet paper --..."
links.text: There's a piece of toilet paper -- or is it cleaning tissue? No, it's toilet paper -- *desperately* sticking to the back of the blue plastic clipboard.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "It's a metaphor -- for you."
links.text: It's a metaphor -- for you.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Thank you, waterlogged ledger, for..."
links.text: Thank you, waterlogged ledger, for spelling it out for us.

links.title: You: "Hold on, what do you mean a metapho..."
links.text: Hold on, what do you mean a metaphor for *me*?

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "FACE THE DESOLATION! This is *your*..."
links.text: FACE THE DESOLATION! This is *your* ledger. You're a COP and it's your official ledger. It's filled out in *your* hand and it *stinks* like you too. And looks like you.

links.title: You: "Ignorantly pass through the eighth..."
links.text: Ignorantly pass through the eighth thousandth sign that it's yours.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "YOU CAN'T! This is *your* ledger. Y..."
links.text: YOU CAN'T! This is *your* ledger. You're a COP and it's your official ledger. It's filled out in *your* hand and it *stinks* like you too. And looks like you.

links.title: You: "I think I got it."
links.text: I think I got it.

links.title: Damaged Ledger: "Right, what more do you need? A rub..."
links.text: Right, what more do you need? A rubber condom stuck to the back? A graffito that says 'DEFEATED'? I think you catch the drift.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Below the pathetics -- terror. Do n..."
links.text: Below the pathetics -- terror. Do not look into its blue heart.

links.title: You: "[Put the ledger away.]"
links.text: [Put the ledger away.]
